key_mistakes.reason: Passive opening choice, giving White an early advantage.
Misplaced pawn, allowing White to strengthen center.
Queen misplacement, not contributing to development.
Allows Black to capture and gain material advantage.
Misses the chance to assert control over the center.
Blunder, failing to pressure the opponent's weaknesses.
Misses a tactical opportunity to capture key pawn.
Weakens pawn structure and loses control.
Weakens pawn structure and allows counterplay.
Passivity allows opponent to gain initiative.

recommendations: Develop pieces with more activity and purpose in the opening.
Avoid unnecessary pawn moves that do not contribute to the position.
Focus on controlling the center and preventing opponent's counterplay.
Be cautious with material exchanges that could lead to imbalances.
Improve endgame technique to convert advantages more effectively.
